name: Streets Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hotel that tries too hard with little that works. The window blinds fell of within 10 mins of us getting there and the workman said that it was normal so why don't they do something about it. The Bang & Olufsen tv had very limited channels and the dvds were damaged and also did not work. Shower is ridiculous as with no door or curtain the entire bathroom gets flooded. The coffee table was chipped and marked and the coffee was not replaced each day. Staff are surly and look at you as though you are an inconvenience!
reviews.title: Not worth the money!

reviews.text: One of the silliest hotels I have evr staed in. They have tried to make it uber-chic: Bang & Oulfsen TV etc, Alessi toilet and basin. They hae failed though to give what is most needed in a hotel room:
reviews.title: Silly hotel. Appalling value for money

reviews.text: Space;
reviews.title: SHABBY and NOT CHIC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sound proofing;
reviews.title: Hotel on the way down
Great design
reviews.text: Curtains;

I stayed here for one night. The location is pretty good. The hotel is a few minutes stroll from the Marais and though on a busy street nice and quiet. It is though one of the silliest hotels I have stayed in. There is a small reception. After check-in you are escorted to your room. You have no choice as there are no door keys. It's fingerprint entry. They set you up and that should be it for the stay. The corridors are almost pitch black. The rooms are spacious with lighting effects. They aren't very effective. The bathroom is a wet room. After a shower it's a very wet room. Beds are comfortable.
reviews.title: Overhyped, overpriced and best avoided
Dont go there
reviews.text: So basically your average boutique hotel. However the upkeep is terrible. Especially in the common areas. Both lifts had broken or faulty floor indicators. The carpets are scuffed and dirty (I think - it's so dark it's hard to tell) - and as for the hotel bar - three of us - a bottle and a half of an OK wine, 3 burgers we ate at the bar. The tab? Over 200 euros. A joke. Back to the room and the fingerprint system doesn't work. Back down to reception again and back up. Boring and annoying. My colleagues had the same problem.

So saving graces? Fantastic staff. And I mean really fantastic staff. Good location. That's it. Not worth the cost I'm afraid. This is a hotel that must have been amazing when it opened but is now shabby and overpriced. Avoid.
reviews.title: Convenient to the Marais but poor value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was dingy, but unfortunately not dingy enough to spot the stained, grubby carpet. Breakfast service was surly and definitely not worth €32 a head. No wonder we were the only people there. The room above had a leak which came through our wardrobe soaking everything. We were offered free lunch as recompense but declined. The only half decent thing about this place was the bar. If you are a vodka fan by all means try the bar but please dont stay at the hotel
reviews.title: do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot of conflicting opinions on this property. I think the best way to think about this property is that it is entertaining (i.e., fun design, biometric entry, etc.) but it isn't particularly comfortable and is very expensive for what you get.
reviews.title: A sleazy hotel, extremely rude staff.

likes.disliked: — rude staff, dark and dirty hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay in February for Valentine's Day Weekend! The hotel room was clean, modern and well appointed. The bathroom shower was awesome and products were fabulous. The hotel is in a nice location and we were able to walk to everything!! Modern cool vibe! The bar was great to have a nice drink before going out for dinner. No complaints!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Botique Hotel...cool vibe"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel regularly and decided to do something a little different on our last vacation to Paris. We hadn't been to Paris since before our kids were born, and we wanted to experience something that would remind us of what we were like when we were young. So we booked the Murano Resort which is in the trendiest part of town (Le Marais) and caters to a twenty to thirty-something crowd. I have to say - it was a wonderful hotel. Beautiful, modern, just like an architectural design showcase. It was expensive, but so is Paris generally. But to be honest, we really think this place is better suited for younger tourists, and I fear that all but the most adventurous 50-something tourists like us would feel more comfortable elsewhere. For example, the hallways were lit by "black lights" - the kind that used to make our fluorescent posters glow in the 1970s. Although we thought this was so creative and interesting, our middle-aged eyes weren't quite able to see where we were going. More than anything, we learned on this trip that as happy as we were to be young once, we think we'll let the younger generation enjoy the stuff that's geared towards them! But if you're adventurous or younger, try the Murano - you'll have a ball, I'm sure!
reviews.title: Quite an adventure for the young and trendy

reviews.text: Great location, on the edge of the trendy Marais district. Rooms change colour from rose pink to sky blue, from solar yellow to floaty lilac with an adjustable lighting system to suit every mood and entry to them is by digital finger device, so no keys. Just don't shuffle and stand still! The bar has 170 varieties of vodkas, exclusively imported and every Friday there are live concerts and celebrity bartenders. 'Full steam ahead' is the fat free menu and the legendary Sunday brunch, said to be one of the most lavish in Paris packs a punch with its stretched timings from 12 pm to 5 pm. A hotel which is popular with the young and hip. While I was there, I ran into an international label's representative and overheard plans for a fashion shoot on the adjoining table. And yes, during my stay, singer Rihanna checked into the honeymoon suite!
reviews.title: New Age Exuberance

reviews.text: The hotel is great need of updating and maintenance. The service was indifferent, food and bar fun but also tired. I had to change a rooms because the bathroom tap wasn't working - this was a endemic problem, apparently. The decor is shabby and carpets and upholstery showing signs of age. The window blinds don't keep out the light. Where this may once have been a modern beacon in a city where it is difficult to find a decent hotel without paying deluxe prices, it is outdated and unloved. And it no longer compensates for the slightly out of the way area. Stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Disappointing and tired

reviews.text: I learned the lesson that I shouldve done research and checked the reviews before I booked this hotel.
reviews.title: I learned the lesson that I shouldve done...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I nearly did not stay at this hotel having read the previous reviews but thank god I did having spoken to someone who had personally stayed.
reviews.title: Cool, fun and sexy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in a double deluxe queen. The first thing to state is that this hotel will not be suitable for all persons. If you are middle aged; a couple seeking a quiet romantic break or a family with kids then give this place a wide berth. This is very much a 20s/30s venue where style and fun is required.
reviews.title: Overpriced and pretentious‎

reviews.text: What about the room. Good size for paris. Loved the big bed and large pillows the mood changing lights and the sophisticated BOSE sound and vision system that plays some cool tunes. The bathroom looked good but I might add that the installation was not professionally done. I enjoy a good shower so was a little disappointed that it was bath hangover type.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Bars: two vodka and martini. Loved them both and were thriving both nights with local trendy parisians. Friday night there was a DJ set playing cool tunes.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel, Terrific Service

reviews.text: Restaurant. Again very stylish. Menu at first disappointing due to choice. My partner had one of her best meals ever. Mine was ok but perhaps was down to poor choice.
reviews.title: Will Never Go Back- Even if They Payed Me

likes.liked: — It was in a good location
likes.disliked: — It really smelled- all four days I was there. Horrible smell.

description: The hip and stylish establishment of the Marais district In the northern part of the Marais district, between République and Bastille, the Murano Paris is a Parisian institution at the origin of a new generation of urban palaces. Luxury is a matter of design and the ambiance is stylish and relaxed. Hi-tech appointments in the rooms ensure guests’ comfort and pleasure. Walls reflect the ambiance colours through a lighting system that can be modulated to one’s liking. A large-screen TV and an iPod station provide evening entertainment. The Honeymoon room boasts a round curtained bed and the bathrooms are designed by Starck. The ultimate in out-of-the-ordinary sophistication in the heart of Paris, two duplex suites have private pools.
